sentences.en: "Oh, Gairdner," he said, as if that meant something to him.
sentences.cn: “哦，盖尔德纳，”他说道，好像他听说过这个名字。

sentences.en: Adhering to the new rules meant inflicting serious damage on motor racing.
sentences.cn: 遵守新的规定就意味着赛车比赛将遭受严重影响。

sentences.en: Asked what she meant, she said mysteriously: "Work it out for yourself".
sentences.cn: 问她是什么意思，她故弄玄虚地说：“你自己想吧。”

sentences.en: Because he had always had money it meant nothing to him.
sentences.cn: 因为他一直不缺钱，所以这对他来说不算什么。

sentences.en: Family holidays are meant to be a break from routine.
sentences.cn: 家庭假日就是从平淡的日常生活中解脱一下。

sentences.en: I asked McKeown if the reunion was meant to achieve closure.
sentences.cn: 我问麦基翁重聚是不是为了寻求解脱。

sentences.en: I can't say any more, it's meant to be a big secret.
sentences.cn: 我再也无可奉告了，这本是重大的秘密。

sentences.en: I did not have the foggiest idea what he meant.
sentences.cn: 我根本不知道他是什么意思。

sentences.en: John was constantly reassuring me that we were meant to be together.
sentences.cn: 约翰不断安慰我说，我们注定要在一起。

sentences.en: Scientific development meant the growth of numerous professions ancillary to medicine.
sentences.cn: 科技发展意味着许多医学衍生职业的增长。

sentences.en: She had meant to make a discreet entrance, but conversation stopped dead.
sentences.cn: 她本打算悄悄进去，但谈话却突然中断了。

sentences.en: That meant that he, notionally at least, outranked them all.
sentences.cn: 那意味着至少理论上他比他们级别高。

sentences.en: The idea that she witnessed this shameful incident meant nothing to him.
sentences.cn: 虽然她目睹了这可耻的一幕，但是这对他来说无关紧要。

sentences.en: They meant to finish her off, swiftly and without mercy.
sentences.cn: 他们打算毫不留情地迅速结果了她。

sentences.en: You know very well what I meant to say.
sentences.cn: 你非常清楚我想说什么。

words.tran_cn: 意味；打算（mean的过去式和过去分词）；表示…的意思

trans.tran_cn: 意味，打算(mean的过去式和过去分词)，表示…的意思
